featured.text: It 21 the kind of welcome it has been getting ever since.
Celebration often begins with mukaebi (welcoming fire), during which people make a small bonfire in front of their house to guide spirits upon their return back home.
Welcome poles were traditionally placed on village beachfronts to greet visitors arriving by canoe.
There were also “couple-free” proms to which all students are welcome.
In addition, Jefferson welcomed visitors to annual receptions on New Year’s Day and on the Fourth of July.

definition.zh_def: 歡迎；接納或招待某人或某事物的行為或表達。
definition.en_def: To greet someone in a friendly manner upon their arrival.
definition.example: We welcome all guests to our event.
